cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north, then turning northeast while paralleling the Texas coastline and moving toward the upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-to-central Texas coast (near Port O’Connor/Matagorda area)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (storm remains inland after Texas landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch east of High Island TX to Sabine Pass; Storm Surge Watch San Luis Pass TX to Rutherford Beach LA (includes Calcasieu Lake area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Rio Grande to High Island TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Aransas to San Luis Pass TX including Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf coast from northeastern Mexico across the entire Texas coast to southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible Tuesday night into Wednesday (sustained 25–35 mph, gusts 40+ mph) with peak probability 15%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Calcasieu Lake and Sabine Lake during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain expected across southwest Louisiana, including Lake Charles, with localized higher totals causing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk and dangerous rip currents/surf along the southwest Louisiana coast.
